meanings.definition: A function that is both injective and surjective.
meanings.sent1: In mathematics, bijections are functions that match each element of one set to a unique element of another set.
meanings.sent2: The concept of bijections is crucial in understanding how sets can be related to each other.
meanings.sent3: The bijections between the two sets were like a perfect dance, each element having a partner.
meanings.sent4: The bijections acted as bridges, connecting the elements of the sets seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing bijections is like watching a synchronized swimming performance, each element moving in harmony with its counterpart.

meanings.definition: The process of establishing a one-to-one correspondence between two sets.
meanings.sent1: When studying sets, bijections help create clear links between elements of different sets.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use bijections to establish precise relationships between elements in distinct sets.
meanings.sent3: The bijections in the math problem were like matchmakers, pairing up elements perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The bijections functioned as translators, ensuring each element had a counterpart in the other set.
meanings.sent5: Using bijections is like creating a map that guides each element from one set to its corresponding element in another set.
